name: UpdateIncidents
description:
Manage the status of multiple incidents.

Use this tool to acknowledge, resolve, escalate, or reassign up to 250 incidents simultaneously. It is useful for addressing and managing problems that need immediate attention. Ensure to stay within the rate limits and have the required 'incidents.write' OAuth permission.

parameters.name: response_version_header
parameters.description: Specifies the API versioning in the `Accept` header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specifies the media type of the request body. Must be 'application/json'.

parameters.name: user_email
parameters.description: The email address of a valid user associated with the account making the request.

value_schema.description: The email address of a valid user associated with the account making the request.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of incident results to return per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_start_offset
parameters.description: Offset from where to start paginated search results. This is used to navigate search results effectively.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: incident_updates
parameters.description: A JSON array detailing incidents to update, including status, type, resolution, title, priority, etc. Max 250 incidents.

id.description: The id of the incident to update.

status.description: The new status of the incident. If the incident is currently resolved, setting the status to "triggered" or "acknowledged" will reopen it. When reopening an incident to the "triggered" status, it will be assigned based on the assignees or escalation_policy fields in the request, otherwise it will be assigned to the current Escalation Policy. When reopening an incident to the "acknowledged" status, it will be assigned to the current user.

resolution.description:
The resolution for this incident. This field is used only when setting the incident status to resolved.
The value provided here is added to the incident’s 'Resolve' log entry as a note and will not be displayed directly in the UI.

title.description: A succinct description of the nature, symptoms, cause, or effect of the incident.

priority.description: The priority of the incident. Can be provided as a priority object or a string matching a priority name. If a string is provided, the highest priority with a matching name will be used.

escalation_level.description: Escalate the incident to this level in the escalation policy.

assignments.description: Assign the incident to these assignees.

name.description: The name of the Incident Type.

conference_number.description: The phone number of the conference call for the conference bridge. Phone numbers should be formatted like +1 415-555-1212,,,,1234#, where a comma (,) represents a one-second wait and pound (#) completes access code input.

conference_url.description: An URL for the conference bridge. This could be a link to a web conference or Slack channel.

incidents.description: An array of incidents, including the parameters to update.

parameters.name: include_total_in_pagination
parameters.description: Set to true to populate the 'total' field in pagination responses. Otherwise, it remains null for faster response times.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: From
parameters.description: The email address of a valid user associated with the account making the request.

value_schema.description: The email address of a valid user associated with the account making the request.
